Summary: Define self-contained stateful UI inside a function. Use Component.Render() and UseState to create inline components with local state, similar to React hooks, without separate classes.
Remarks: Inline components collapse a component and its state into a single function. Use Component.Render(Func<VisualNode>) to create an on-the-fly hidden stateful component, and UseState<S>() to declare local state (often simple tuples). This pattern is ideal for small, reusable UI building blocks (e.g., themed controls) that need minimal, self-contained state and no external dependencies. Tip: avoid naming collisions with built-in components when declaring local fields (e.g., use _labelText instead of _label).
